data.title: Top 10 companies providing enterprise cloud security
data.meta_description: Cyber Magazine looks at a selection of the worldâ€™s leading providers of cloud services and the security operations that keep them safe in a dangerous world
data.text:
With the increasing use of cloud computing and the storage of sensitive information in the cloud, the importance of having a secure cloud environment cannot be overstated. The companies on this list have demonstrated their expertise and commitment to providing their customers with the highest level of cloud security.

These companies have a proven track record of delivering secure cloud solutions to organizations of all sizes and industries. From large enterprises to small businesses, these companies offer cloud security solutions that meet each customer's unique needs.

Whether you're looking to improve your security posture, meet compliance requirements, or simply protect your valuable data and applications, these companies offer the expertise and solutions you need to achieve your security goals. These leaders in cloud security are committed to helping organizations like yours stay secure in the constantly evolving world of cloud computing.

10. Palo Alto Networks Cloud Security

Palo Alto Networks is a multinational cybersecurity company that was established in 2005. It's headquartered in Santa Clara, California and has operations across the globe.

The company offers best-in-class capabilities to prevent, detect, and effectively respond to all threats across every vector - including network, cloud, endpoints and software supply chain. They are also dedicated to protecting all users, applications, and infrastructure in every environment, enabling a comprehensive Zero Trust infrastructure.

As per Forrester, Palo Alto Networks has procured, acquired, or built every tool or capability an organization could need to operate a Zero Trust infrastructure. The company also offers network security, leveraging the network effect crowdsourced from the industry's largest footprint of the network, endpoint, and cloud intelligence sources.

8. Trend Micro

Trend Micro is a multinational cybersecurity company that was founded in 1988. The company is headquartered in Tokyo, Japan and operates in multiple countries worldwide.

Trend Micro provides security solutions for businesses, consumers, and governments to help protect against the latest cyber threats, including viruses, malware, and ransomware. The company's security solutions are available for various platforms, including Windows, Mac, Android, and iOS.

Trend Micro has a long history of working with cloud security and has been a pioneer in this field for many years. The company provides a range of cloud security solutions, including cloud access security brokers (CASBs), cloud workload protection platforms (CWPPs), and cloud security posture management (CSPM) solutions. These solutions help organizations secure their cloud infrastructure and protect against threats that may originate from the cloud.

4. IBM Cloud Security Solutions

IBM Cloud is a subsidiary of IBM Corporation, a multinational technology company. IBM Cloud also places a strong emphasis on data protection, offering solutions to locate, classify, and secure critical data wherever it resides, with the option to keep your own cloud data encryption keys. The platform provides identity and access management (IAM) capabilities to help organizations manage who has access to their data, ensuring only those with the appropriate level of access are granted permission.

To support a hybrid multi-cloud environment, IBM Cloud offers a hybrid multi-cloud security platform that allows organizations to connect to their data sources without moving their data, in addition to acting faster with orchestration and automation across different tools and teams. IBM Cloud Pak for Security is a key solution in this regard, providing a centralized approach to security management in a hybrid, multicloud environment.

3. Google Cloud

Google Cloud is a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc. - the parent company of Google - and operates in multiple countries worldwide.

Google Cloud offers a modern cloud infrastructure built on open source, allowing organizations to run their workloads in the right place for their needs. Additionally, the global network of Google Cloud offers three times the input at half the administration cost compared to other cloud providers.

Google Workspace is a tool that integrates video calling, email, chat, and document collaboration into one place, with over 3 billion users. The platform is built with a zero-trust approach and features enterprise-grade access management, data protection, encryption, and endpoint protections.

Threat management solutions from Google Cloud allow organizations to manage threats and events with precise insights, adapting to new threats as well as rapidly detecting and responding to attacks. In terms of data protection, Google Cloud offers solutions that help organizations locate, classify, secure, and manage their critical data. Identity and access management (IAM) solutions help organizations identify and manage who has appropriate access across their hybrid multi-cloud environment. The hybrid multi-cloud security platform allows organizations to connect to data sources without moving their data, acting faster with orchestration and automation across tools and teams.
